answers.answer: Hi!You are probably talking about urine protein levels. If taking potassium has helped bring the protein levels down, then you probably have a kidney problem. This could be secondary to diabetes, infection of high blood pressure. You need blood pressure monitoring and blood and urine tests to rule out these causes. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: For 11 eleven months my protine levelswere between 2.0 and 2.5 this timeit was 1.3, the only different thing I havedone is start taking potassium???
title: heart disorder
